weaponRunes.name: Returning
text: When you make a thrown Strike with this weapon, it flies back to your hand after the Strike is complete. If your hands are full when the weapon returns, it falls to the ground in your space.

weaponRunes.name: Ghost Touch
text: The weapon can harm creatures without physical form. A
ghost touch
weapon is particularly effective against incorporeal creatures, which almost always have a specific weakness to
ghost touch
weapons. Incorporeal creatures can touch, hold, and wield
ghost touch
weapons (unlike most physical objects).

weaponRunes.name: Disrupting
text: A
weapon pulses with positive energy, dealing an extra 1d6 positive damage to undead. On a critical hit, the undead is also enfeebled 1 until the end of your next turn.

weaponRunes.name: Shifting
text: With a moment of manipulation, you can shift this weapon into a different weapon with a similar form.
weaponRunes.Effect: The weapon takes the shape of another melee weapon that requires the same number of hands to wield. The weapon’s runes and any precious material it’s made of apply to the weapon’s new shape. Any property runes that can’t apply to the new form are suppressed until the item takes a shape to which they can apply.

weaponRunes.name: Wounding
text: Weapons with wounding runes are said to thirst for blood. When you hit a creature with a wounding weapon, you deal an extra 1d6 persistent bleed damage. On a critical hit, it instead deals 1d12 persistent bleed damage.
weaponRunes.Usage: etched onto a piercing or slashing melee weapon

weaponRunes.name: Corrosive
text: Acid sizzles across the surface of the weapon. When you hit with the weapon, add 1d6 acid damage to the damage dealt. In addition, on a critical hit, the target’s armor (if any) takes 3d6 acid damage (before applying Hardness); if the target has a shield raised, the shield takes this damage instead.

weaponRunes.name: Corrosive (Greater)
text: Acid sizzles across the surface of the weapon. When you hit with the weapon, add 1d6 acid damage to the damage dealt. In addition, on a critical hit, the target’s armor (if any) takes 3d6 acid damage (before applying Hardness); if the target has a shield raised, the shield takes this damage instead.
The acid damage dealt by this weapon ignores the target’s acid resistance. Increase the acid damage dealt to armor or a shield on a critical hit to 6d6.

weaponRunes.name: Flaming
text: This weapon is empowered by flickering flame. The weapon deals an additional 1d6 fire damage on a successful Strike, plus 1d10 persistent fire damage on a critical hit.

weaponRunes.name: Flaming (Greater)
text: This weapon is empowered by flickering flame. The weapon deals an additional 1d6 fire damage on a successful Strike, plus 1d10 persistent fire damage on a critical hit.
Increase the persistent damage on a critical hit to 2d10. Fire damage dealt by this weapon (including the persistent fire damage) ignores the target’s fire resistance.

weaponRunes.name: Frost
text: This weapon is empowered with freezing ice. It deals an additional 1d6 cold damage on a successful Strike. On a critical hit, the target is also slowed 1 until the end of your next turn unless it succeeds at a DC 24 Fortitude save.

weaponRunes.name: Frost (Greater)
text: This weapon is empowered with freezing ice. It deals an additional 1d6 cold damage on a successful Strike. On a critical hit, the target is also slowed 1 until the end of your next turn unless it succeeds at a DC 24 Fortitude save.
The save DC is 34. Cold damage dealt by this weapon ignores the target’s cold resistance.

weaponRunes.name: Shock
text: Electric arcs crisscross this weapon, dealing an extra 1d6 electricity damage on a hit. On a critical hit, electricity arcs out to deal an equal amount of electricity damage to up to two other creatures of your choice within 10 feet of the target.

weaponRunes.name: Shock (Greater)
text: Electric arcs crisscross this weapon, dealing an extra 1d6 electricity damage on a hit. On a critical hit, electricity arcs out to deal an equal amount of electricity damage to up to two other creatures of your choice within 10 feet of the target.
Electricity damage dealt by this weapon ignores the target’s electricity resistance (and the other creatures’ on a critical hit).

weaponRunes.name: Thundering
text: This weapon lets out a peal of thunder when it hits, dealing an extra 1d6 sonic damage on a successful Strike. On a critical hit, the target has to succeed at a DC 24 Fortitude save or be deafened for 1 minute (or 1 hour on a critical failure).

weaponRunes.name: Thundering (Greater)
text: This weapon lets out a peal of thunder when it hits, dealing an extra 1d6 sonic damage on a successful Strike. On a critical hit, the target has to succeed at a DC 24 Fortitude save or be deafened for 1 minute (or 1 hour on a critical failure).
The save DC is 34, and the deafness is permanent. Sonic damage dealt by this weapon ignores the target’s sonic resistance.

weaponRunes.name: Grevious
text: When your attack roll with this weapon is a critical hit and gains the critical specialization effect, you gain an additional benefit depending on the weapon group.
weaponRunes.Axe: You can damage a third creature, with the same restrictions.
weaponRunes.Bow: The Athletics check to pull the missile free is DC 20.
weaponRunes.Brawling: The target takes a –4 circumstance penalty to its save.
weaponRunes.Club: You can knock the target up to 15 feet away.
weaponRunes.Dart: The base persistent bleed damage increases to 2d6.
weaponRunes.Flail: You move the target 5 feet. You can’t move it away from you, but you can move it in another direction of your choice.
weaponRunes.Hammer: You can also knock the target 5 feet away from you.
weaponRunes.Knife: The target takes a –5-foot status penalty to its Speed while it has the persistent bleed damage.
weaponRunes.Pick: The extra damage from the critical specialization effect increases to 4 per weapon damage die.
weaponRunes.Polearm: You can move the target up to 10 feet.
weaponRunes.Shield: You can knock the target up to 10 feet away.
weaponRunes.Sling: The target also takes a –10-foot status penalty to its Speed for 1 round if it fails the save.
weaponRunes.Spear: The enfeebled condition lasts for 2 rounds.
weaponRunes.Sword: The target is flat-footed until the end of your next turn.

anarchic

rune is jagged and asymmetrical, channeling chaotic energy. A weapon with this rune deals an additional 1d6 chaotic damage against lawful targets. If you are lawful, you are enfeebled 2 while carrying or wielding this weapon.

When you critically succeed at a Strike with this weapon against a lawful creature, roll 1d6. On a 1 or 2, you deal double minimum damage; on a 3 or 4, double your damage normally; on a 5 or 6, you deal double maximum damage.

axiomatic

If you are chaotic, you are enfeebled 2 while carrying or wielding this weapon. When you critically succeed at an attack roll with this weapon against a chaotic creature, instead of rolling, count each weapon damage die as average damage rounded up (3 for d4, 4 for d6, 5 for d8, 6 for d10, 7 for d12).

weaponRunes.Usage: etched onto a weapon without a

weaponRunes.name: Dancing
text: A dancing weapon flies autonomously and strikes your foes.
dancing
weaponRunes.Effect: Each round, when the weapon is finished using its actions, attempt a DC 6 flat check. On a failure, the activation ends and the weapon falls to the ground. You can’t activate the item again for 10 minutes.

weaponRunes.name: Spell-Storing
text: A
spell-storing

rune creates a reservoir of eldritch energy within the etched weapon. A spellcaster can spend 1 minute to cast a spell of 3rd level or lower into the weapon. The spell must have a casting of 2 actions or fewer and must be able to target a creature other than the caster. The spell has no immediate effect—it is instead stored for later. When you wield a
spell-storing
weapon, you immediately know the name and level of the stored spell. A
spell-storing
weapon found as treasure has a 50% chance of having a spell of the GM’s choice stored in it.
weaponRunes.Requirements: On your previous action this turn, you hit and damaged a creature with this weapon;
weaponRunes.Effect: Harmlessly expend the stored spell. This frees the weapon to have a new spell cast into it.

weaponRunes.name: Keen
text: The edges of a keen weapon are preternaturally sharp. Attacks with this weapon are a critical hit on a 19 on the die as long as that result is a success. This property has no effect on a 19 if the result would be a failure.
weaponRunes.Usage: etched onto a piercing or slashing melee weapon

weaponRunes.name: Speed
text: Attacks with a
speed
weapon are supernaturally swift. While wielding a
speed
weapon, you gain the quickened condition, but you can use the additional action granted only to make a Strike with the etched weapon.

weaponRunes.name: Vorpal
text: Originally created as a means of slaying the legendary jabberwock,
vorpal
weapons prove equally effective against nearly any foe with a head.
weaponRunes.Usage: etched onto a slashing melee weapon
weaponRunes.Frequency: You roll a natural 20 on a Strike with the weapon, critically succeed, and deal slashing damage. The target must have a head;
weaponRunes.Effect: The target must succeed at a DC 37 Fortitude save or be decapitated. This kills any creature except ones that don’t require a head to live. For creatures with multiple heads, this usually kills the creature only if you sever its last head.
